org.apache.juneau.jena

Interface RdfCommon

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RdfParser, RdfParser.N3, RdfParser.NTriple, RdfParser.Turtle, RdfParser.Xml, RdfSerializer, RdfSerializer.N3, RdfSerializer.NTriple, RdfSerializer.Turtle, RdfSerializer.Xml, RdfSerializer.XmlAbbrev

    public interface RdfCommon
    Configurable properties common to both the RdfSerializer and RdfParser classes.

        Constant Field Values

      • LANG_PROP_MAP

        static final Map<String,String> LANG_PROP_MAP
        Maps RDF writer names to property prefixes that apply to them.

      • RDF_language

        static final String RDF_language
        Configuration property: RDF language.
        Property:
        • Name: "Rdf.language.s"
        • Data type: String
        • Default: "RDF/XML-ABBREV"
        • Methods:
          • RdfSerializerBuilder.language(String)
          • RdfSerializerBuilder.n3()
          • RdfSerializerBuilder.ntriple()
          • RdfSerializerBuilder.turtle()
          • RdfSerializerBuilder.xml()
          • RdfSerializerBuilder.xmlabbrev()
          • RdfParserBuilder.language(String)
          • RdfParserBuilder.n3()
          • RdfParserBuilder.ntriple()
          • RdfParserBuilder.turtle()
          • RdfParserBuilder.xml()
        Description:

        Can be any of the following:

        • "RDF/XML"
        • "RDF/XML-ABBREV" (default)
        • "N-TRIPLE"
        • "N3" - General name for the N3 writer. Will make a decision on exactly which writer to use (pretty writer, plain writer or simple writer) when created. Default is the pretty writer but can be overridden with system property com.hp.hpl.jena.n3.N3JenaWriter.writer.
        • "N3-PP" - Name of the N3 pretty writer. The pretty writer uses a frame-like layout, with prefixing, clustering like properties and embedding one-referenced bNodes.
        • "N3-PLAIN" - Name of the N3 plain writer. The plain writer writes records by subject.
        • "N3-TRIPLES" - Name of the N3 triples writer. This writer writes one line per statement, like N-Triples, but does N3-style prefixing.
        • "TURTLE" - Turtle writer. http://www.dajobe.org/2004/01/turtle/
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RDF_juneauNs

        static final String RDF_juneauNs
        Configuration property: XML namespace for Juneau properties.

      • RDF_useXmlNamespaces

        static final String RDF_useXmlNamespaces
        Configuration property: Reuse XML namespaces when RDF namespaces not specified.
        Property:
        • Name: "Rdf.useXmlNamespaces.b"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: true
        • Methods:
          • RdfSerializerBuilder.useXmlNamespaces(boolean)
          • RdfParserBuilder.useXmlNamespaces(boolean)
        Description:

        When specified, namespaces defined using @XmlNs and @Xml will be inherited by the RDF serializers. Otherwise, namespaces will be defined using @RdfNs and @Rdf.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RDF_arp_iriRules

        static final String RDF_arp_iriRules
        Configuration property: RDF/XML property: iri_rules.
        Property:
        • Name: "Rdf.jena.rdfXml.iri-rules.s"
        • Data type: String
        • Default: "lax"
        Description:

        Set the engine for checking and resolving.

        Possible values:

        • "lax" - The rules for RDF URI references only, which does permit spaces although the use of spaces is not good practice.
        • "strict" - Sets the IRI engine with rules for valid IRIs, XLink and RDF; it does not permit spaces in IRIs.
        • "iri" - Sets the IRI engine to IRI (RFC 3986, RFC 3987).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RDF_arp_errorMode

        static final String RDF_arp_errorMode
        Configuration property: RDF/XML ARP property: error-mode.
        Property:
        • Name: "Rdf.jena.rdfXml.error-mode.s"
        • Data type: String
        • Default: "lax"
        Description:

        This allows a coarse-grained approach to control of error handling.

        Possible values:

        • "default"
        • "lax"
        • "strict"
        • "strict-ignore"
        • "strict-warning"
        • "strict-error"
        • "strict-fatal"

        See also:

        • ARPOptions.setDefaultErrorMode()
        • ARPOptions.setLaxErrorMode()
        • ARPOptions.setStrictErrorMode()
        • ARPOptions.setStrictErrorMode(int)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RDF_rdfxml_longId

        static final String RDF_rdfxml_longId
        Configuration property: RDF/XML property: longId.
        Property:
        • Name: "Rdf.jena.rdfXml.longId.b"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: false
        Description:

        Whether to use long ID's for anon resources. Short ID's are easier to read, but can run out of memory on very large models.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RDF_rdfxml_allowBadUris

        static final String RDF_rdfxml_allowBadUris

        Property:
        • Name: "Rdf.jena.rdfXml.allowBadURIs.b"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: false
        Description:

        URIs in the graph are, by default, checked prior to serialization.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RDF_rdfxml_relativeUris

        static final String RDF_rdfxml_relativeUris
        Configuration property: RDF/XML property: relativeURIs.
        Property:
        • Name: "Rdf.jena.rdfXml.relativeURIs.s"
        • Data type: String
        • Default: "same-document, absolute, relative, parent"
        Description:

        What sort of relative URIs should be used.

        A comma separate list of options:

        • "same-document" - Same-document references (e.g. "" or "#foo")
        • "network" - Network paths (e.g. "//example.org/foo" omitting the URI scheme)
        • "absolute" - Absolute paths (e.g. "/foo" omitting the scheme and authority)
        • "relative" - Relative path not beginning in "../"
        • "parent" - Relative path beginning in "../"
        • "grandparent" - Relative path beginning in "../../"

        The default value is "same-document, absolute, relative, parent". To switch off relative URIs use the value "". Relative URIs of any of these types are output where possible if and only if the option has been specified.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RDF_rdfxml_showXmlDeclaration

        static final String RDF_rdfxml_showXmlDeclaration
        Configuration property: RDF/XML property: showXmlDeclaration.
        Property:
        • Name: "Rdf.jena.rdfXml.showXmlDeclaration.s"
        • Data type: String
        • Default: "default"
        Description:

        Possible values:

        • "true" - Add XML Declaration to the output.
        • "false" - Don't add XML Declaration to the output.
        • "default" - Only add an XML Declaration when asked to write to an OutputStreamWriter that uses some encoding other than UTF-8 or UTF-16. In this case the encoding is shown in the XML declaration.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RDF_rdfxml_showDoctypeDeclaration

        static final String RDF_rdfxml_showDoctypeDeclaration
        Configuration property: RDF/XML property: showDoctypeDeclaration.
        Property:
        • Name: "Rdf.jena.rdfXml.showDoctypeDeclaration.b"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: true
        Description:

        If true, an XML doctype declaration is included in the output. This declaration includes a !ENTITY declaration for each prefix mapping in the model, and any attribute value that starts with the URI of that mapping is written as starting with the corresponding entity invocation.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RDF_collectionFormat

        static final String RDF_collectionFormat
        Configuration property: RDF format for representing collections and arrays.
        Property:
        • Name: "Rdf.collectionFormat.s"
        • Data type: String
        • Default: "DEFAULT"
        • Methods:
          • RdfSerializerBuilder.collectionFormat(RdfCollectionFormat)
          • RdfParserBuilder.collectionFormat(RdfCollectionFormat)
        Description:

        Possible values:

        • "DEFAULT" - Default format. The default is an RDF Sequence container.
        • "SEQ" - RDF Sequence container.
        • "BAG" - RDF Bag container.
        • "LIST" - RDF List container.
        • "MULTI_VALUED" - Multi-valued properties.
        Notes:
        • If you use "BAG" or "MULTI_VALUED", the order of the elements in the collection will get lost.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • RDF_looseCollections

        static final String RDF_looseCollections
        Configuration property: Collections should be serialized and parsed as loose collections.
        Property:
        • Name: "Rdf.looseCollections.b"
        • Data type: Boolean
        • Default: false
        • Methods:
          • RdfSerializerBuilder.looseCollections(boolean)
          • RdfSerializerBuilder.looseCollections()
          • RdfParserBuilder.looseCollections(boolean)
          • RdfParserBuilder.looseCollections()
        Description:

        When specified, collections of resources are handled as loose collections of resources in RDF instead of resources that are children of an RDF collection (e.g. Sequence, Bag).

        Note that this setting is specialized for RDF syntax, and is incompatible with the concept of losslessly representing POJO models, since the tree structure of these POJO models are lost when serialized as loose collections.

        This setting is typically only useful if the beans being parsed into do not have a bean property annotated with @Rdf(beanUri=true).

        Example:

        WriterSerializer s = RdfSerializer.create().xmlabbrev().looseCollections(true).build(); ReaderParser p = RdfParser.create().xml().looseCollections(true).build(); List<MyBean> l = createListOfMyBeans(); // Serialize to RDF/XML as loose resources String rdfXml = s.serialize(l); // Parse back into a Java collection l = p.parse(rdfXml, LinkedList.class, MyBean.class); MyBean[] b = createArrayOfMyBeans(); // Serialize to RDF/XML as loose resources String rdfXml = s.serialize(b); // Parse back into a bean array b = p.parse(rdfXml, MyBean[].class);

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
